jobs.title: Business Development Intern
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Our Core games team is divided into Publishing, Partnership and Studios teams. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the largest and most successful hybrid publisher in the world.

Role

To succeed in this role, you will need to have a good passion for gaming.

Your role will be focused on two challenges: Work hand in hand with the Business Development Lead, and Publishing Associates/Managers and find the best hybrid-casual studios and developers in the market while staying current on industry trends and developments.

Missions

  • Identify and qualify the best prospects worldwide and high-potential studios

  • Qualify incoming leads

  • Identify and share key data points in the market (including sales) on our main competitors

  • Search for studios creatively and collect information on our prospects

  • Monitor our test platform so that high-potential studios can join our coaching programme

  • Carry out ad hoc strategic and quantitative analysis to formulate strategic recommendations concerning the allocation of resources to our portfolio of studios

  • Participate in commercial calls with Publishing Managers to bring together attractive studios and negotiate the best contracts with them

  • Coordinate with the Legal function until the signing of the contracts negotiated with the studios

  • Help the Publishing Associates to find information for future prospects in specific territories

Profile

  • You have ideally at least one experience in consulting, banking, PE or VC; and a strong interest for Tech companies

  • You have a strong interest in the mobile games industry

  • You have good organisational skills, pay close attention to detail and have strong problem-solving skills

  • You're not afraid to constantly try new things to find the right information in the right place

  • You have good verbal and communication skills

  • You are fluent in English

  • You are ideally available starting January 2026

Benefits

  • Lunch vouchers,

  • Gym & Well-being,

  • Social and Economic Committee,

  • Remote days

Our Growth team helps maximize the potential of each Voodoo product within the ecosystem. Our Growth team is split into several job expertise such as user acquisition, ad monetization, video ads, playable ads, and influencer marketers. Being part of the Growth Team at Voodoo requires a lot of operational excellence and creativity in order to constantly adapt ourselves to stay ahead of the rest of the market.

Our core team mission in the Playable Ads team is to create engaging and interactive advertising experiences that captivate audiences and drive conversions. We work with playable developers and coordinators that turn a game into a HTML interactive ad experience. Your main mission will be to  produce high-performing ads by creating and uploading them to our different networks.

Role

We are looking for amazing individuals interested in creating playable ads for users to be able to try out our games! To succeed in this role, you need extensive Unity development experience with a past of creating unique user experiences for a global audience. You will be converting existing games into playable games and furthermore collaborating with the creation of tools for other interactive ad formats. 

  • Transform existing games into interactive user experiences with Unity, using specific platform that can convert Unity projects into playables

  • Optimize playable ads for best user experience, scalability and adaptability

  • Build interactive playable templates, customizable by any graphic designer

  • Adequate knowledge of objects oriented programming and web game development

  • Proactive problem diagnosis and creative problem-solving skills

  • Fluent in English, both oral and written

jobs.title: Chief of Staff
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Role

The position of Chief of Staff actively supports the CEO in scaling Voodoo in the coming years, structuring executive routines and managing initiatives across business units towards strategic company goals. This role is essentially to be the right hand of the leadership group on the most strategic topics across the company.

Responsabilities

  • Challenge, formalise, and ensure the good execution of the Voodoo strategy

  • Increase the effectiveness of our CEO in cascading initiatives down at all levels (streamline processes and communication)

  • Ensure the smooth running of all company routines (executive meetings, performance reviews, presentation to employees, board meetings, etc.)

  • Support the CEO in key M&A and fund raising activities

  • Identify key strategic projects for the company, ensure that they are appropriately staffed with the right stakeholders, monitor their evolution and ensure that they are delivered on time

  • Help the CEO to hire for key positions in the company (VP/C-level roles, strategy roles, etc.)

  • Perform market research & analysis on key opportunities to scale Voodoo

  • Help structure and scale the company and coordinate core business functions and support functions to reach strategic goals

  • Occasionally, step in to run one-off projects (e.g. fund raising process, launch of new business venture, M&A integration, etc.)

Profile

  • Deep strategic and systemic thinking

  • Versatile mind, able to learn fast and challenge business-as-usual operations

  • Demonstrable competency in strategic planning and business development

  • Organizational and leadership abilities

  • Passion for the tech industry

  • Low ego, humble, no political behavior

  • Top Engineering or Business School

  • Management experience in a top tier consulting firm (Mc Kinsey, Bain, BCG,...)

  • Fluent in French and English

jobs.title: Technical Lead - Puzzle Games
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

This position is Paris-based, with relocation support available.

Team

We are seeking a talented Technical Lead to lead our team in creating our next casual hit. This unique opportunity involves defining and building the foundation of a new puzzle game studio from the ground up, covering technical, operational, and strategic aspects:

  • Partner with the General Manager to structure, recruit, and onboard the technical team

  • Define and establish the technical foundations for a new puzzle game, addressing all aspects from prototype to worldwide launch, including the creation of the switcher engine, level editor, and future live operations

  • Develop and implement ways of working for the engineering craft, including technical practices, team rituals, and collaboration processes

  • Define an execute the long-term technical strategy for the studio, ensuring scalability for both the team and the game, in alignment with the overall product and studio strategy

  • Work with product leadership on roadmap, rollouts, and adoption strategies

  • Engage in hands-on coding when needed, building new features and iterating rapidly based on player feedback and market testing

  • Monitor the health of the product, guiding the technical team to continuously enhance product quality and address issues promptly

  • Help the General Manager and other Leads manage the studio, contributing to its strategy, operations, and people management, always fostering a culture of innovation and creativity


With this role, you will have a strong impact on the company by contributing daily to important decisions with a multidisciplinary team of passionate and talented people working on one of the most successful Voodoo games. Flesh out the details of a game's design, oversee its testing and revise the game in response to player feedback. Thanks to your creativity and your teamwork, let’s entertain millions of people with our hit games.

Profile

  • 3 years of experience as a Technical Director or Technical Lead on casual games

  • At least 5+ years of professional experience with Unity

  • Successful track record in top-tier mobile casual games, with experience in both new and live game development

  • Experience in creating, growing, and leading engineering teams

  • A creative and innovative mindset with strong problem-solving skills

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Comfortable switching from management work to hands-on coding as needed

  • Experience with backend development or client-server interactions

  • Extremely passionate about casual games and driven to create a new hit

  • Entrepreneurial mindset, enthusiastic about building new things from the ground up

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits according to the country you reside

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. You will be an integral part of a newly established internal studio, a dynamic and focused team dedicated to elevating some of the most promising game concepts emerging from our innovative prototyping teams. This studio is specifically chartered to take high-potential prototypes and evolve them into successful, market-ready titles.

In this exciting role, your initial focus will be on Card Factory, a game that has already demonstrated significant promise and captured our attention with their compelling core mechanics and engaging gameplay.

You'll have the opportunity to contribute directly to the growth and refinement of Card Factory, leveraging its existing traction to build a truly exceptional player experience. This is a unique chance to join a project with established momentum while still having a significant impact on the future direction within a dedicated and agile studio environment.

Role

  • Creating high-quality 2D and 3D VFX, including motion graphics & animations

  • Developing and implementing visual effects for core gameplay, character abilities, environmental effects, and reward animations

  • Collaborating with designers, artists, and developers to integrate 3D assets and VFX seamlessly into the game

  • Working with developers to adapt and integrate new art features based on project specifications

  • Developing and maintaining VFX pipelines and workflows to ensure efficient production processes

  • Troubleshooting and solving technical issues related to motion graphics & animations & VFX creation and implementation

jobs.title: Senior Game Artist - Mob Control
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

This position can be fully remote, ideally within CET +/-2h.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.

You’ll join one of our Live Studios as a Senior Game Artist on Mob Control, helping us create a truly unforgettable game played by millions!

Role

As Senior Game Artist, you will have full ownership in the game features you are involved in. We look for somebody who is T-shaped, with great eye for detail, specially when it comes to timing, motion design, in-game sequences and the intersection between gameplay and UI.

  • Design, create, and implement visually striking assets and in game sequences that elevate the artistic quality of our game.

  • Propose and execute improvements that elevate game-feel and player experience in both meta and gameplay.

  • Full responsibility for art in the features you work on, reporting to the Creative Director.

  • Set up rigs, and animation sytems in order to achieve an stylized and fluid experience.

  • Animate popups, game elements, Ui and characters to transmit the desired emotions to players.

  • Be aware and incorporate the most performant and optimized ways to deliver assets budget-friendly.

  • Work closely with the art team and developers to ensure seamless asset integration and maintain consistent style and quality.

Profile

  • Strong understanding of the technical aspects of art in mobile gaming.

  • Proficient in 3D modeling and texturing using tools such as Blender, Maya, or equivalent.

  • Experienced with game engine workflows and asset integration; experience with Unity is a plus.

  • Skilled in 2D design tools, including Photoshop, Figma, and Illustrator.

  • Experienced in VFX, animation, and motion design.

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits according to the country you reside

jobs.title: Product Manager - Paper.io 2
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.


Team


Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.


You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on Paper.io 2.


We’re building an iconic game that players will never forget!

We're a small team of excellent people who take care of everything from ideas to testing, and we intend to grow while maintaining our high standards.


Role


We’re looking for a Product Manager to drive the success of Paper.io 2. In this role, you will focus on live operations, economy systems, and feature optimization to maximize player engagement and business growth. You’ll collaborate with a small, high-performing team, ensuring fast execution, continuous iteration, and measurable impact.

  • Build and implement F2P systems that enhance player engagement and revenue, with a focus on progression, monetization, live events, and in-game economies.

  • Take full ownership of specifications, timelines, and outcomes, ensuring smooth execution and high-quality delivery.

  • Utilize A/B testing, retention metrics, and player data to refine and optimize features post-launch. Identify strengths, address weaknesses, and iterate for continuous improvement.

  • Collaborate closely with developers, artists, and analysts to ensure seamless feature rollouts. Maintain clear documentation, resolve technical challenges, and make strategic trade-offs to deliver the best possible player experience.

  • Prioritize development efforts under tight deadlines, balancing speed and quality to maximize impact.

  • Stay ahead of industry trends by monitoring competitors, analyzing market innovations, and rapidly adapting best practices.

Profile

  • 5+ years of experience in mobile F2P games in a product-focused role, specializing in economy, live events, and live operations.

  • Proven ability to launch and refine player-facing features, leveraging data to drive engagement, retention, and monetization.

  • Strong foundation in product analytics, with experience reading dashboards and applying data insights to optimize performance.

  • Skilled in roadmap planning, market analysis, and user research to identify opportunities and maximize business success.

  • A track record of shipping features and using data-driven decisions to improve and refine existing systems.

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits according to the country you reside

We are looking for a talented Freelance Senior iOS Engineer to join our team, where you will focus on improving the iOS app experience for millions of users.

jobs.title: Creative Strategist - Outsourcing
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Growth team helps maximize the potential of each Voodoo product within the ecosystem. Our Growth team is split into several job expertise such as user acquisition, ad monetization, video ads, playable ads, and influencer marketers. Being part of the Growth Team at Voodoo requires a lot of operational excellence and creativity in order to constantly adapt ourselves to stay ahead of the rest of the market.

Role

Voodoo is looking for a Creative Strategist to join its Outsourcing Creative team, which produces performance-driven ad creatives to attract new users and optimize campaign impact. You will drive the creative vision and strategic direction across our entire portfolio of games and apps—identifying trends, guiding creative decisions, and helping turn great mobile products into global hits. You’ll also be responsible for transforming strategic insights into clear, actionable creative briefs rooted in benchmarking and ideation, enabling Creative Leads and Producers to execute with clarity and impact.

Responsibilities

  • Define and lead the creative vision and strategy per game/app in collaboration with Creative Leads.

  • Generate structured, insight-driven creative briefs based on your benchmark analysis, market intelligence, and strategic ideation frameworks.

  • Define guidelines, priorities, and execution standards of the production on a weekly basis.

  • Conduct and continuously update extensive benchmarks by leveraging internal tools and third-party platforms (e.g., MarketIQ, Apptica, Data.ai) to identify high-performing creative trends early.

  • Analyze and deconstruct top-performing competitor creatives, providing actionable insights and storytelling patterns to inform ideation.

  • Benchmark across both mobile games (e.g. Match-3, Hypercasual, Hybridcasual) and apps (e.g. Blitz, Wizz, WeMoms, and future products).

  • Collaborate with Creative Leads, Producers, and the Data Team to ensure effective adoption of benchmarks, streamline reporting, and scale creative learnings across teams.

  • Audit and improve existing creative workflows and propose strategic enhancements to maximize output and creative impact.

  • Identify skill gaps in the creative team (e.g. motion design, 3D animation) and actively participate in sourcing and recruitment of new creative talent.

Profile

  • Proven experience in a similar role, strategy consulting, or product/creative marketing.

  • Ability to envision, articulate, and document compelling creative strategies.

  • Strong skills in strategic planning, market analysis, and insight generation to align creative direction with user acquisition goals.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

This position is fully remote within 2hrs time difference of Barcelona.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.

You will be a member of a team of 15 and you will participate in every aspect of development, from ideation to testing the casual game in the market.

You will be joining one of our Live Studios, Samba Studio, working on Hole.io.

Role

  • Oversee the artistic vision and direction of a live game with a large player-base, ensuring a cohesive and appealing visual style.

  • Lead the design and development of game assets, including characters, environments, and user interface elements, with a focus on creating a memorable player experience.

  • Drive the enhancement of the game with striking visual effects (VFX) and fluid animations, setting high standards for visual quality.

  • Coordinate closely with development teams to integrate artistic elements in Unity, addressing technical challenges through innovative solutions.

  • Guide the use of 2D and 3D techniques to elevate game visuals, making strategic decisions based on the game’s needs.

  • Champion the adoption of advanced art production tools and techniques to streamline workflows and improve asset quality.

Profile

  • Extensive experience in art direction within the mobile gaming industry, with a proven track record of successful projects.

  • Mastery of Photoshop, Unity, and Blender (or equivalent 3D software), with a deep understanding of their application in game development.

  • Strong technical acumen to optimize assets and workflows for mobile platforms, ensuring efficiency and high performance.

  • Solid artistic foundations with exceptional attention to detail and a commitment to delivering visually stunning games.

  • A collaborative leader, skilled in fostering teamwork and communication, adept at giving and receiving feedback to drive creative excellence.

  • Passionate about the mobile games market, with a data-driven approach to decision-making and a commitment to leveraging insights for game improvement.

  • Innovative mindset, with a willingness to experiment and iterate rapidly to validate ideas and push creative boundaries.

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits according to the country you reside

You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on Paper.io 2.

With Paper.io 2, we’re building an iconic game that players will never forget!

We're a small team of excellent people who take care of everything from ideas to testing, and we intend to grow while maintaining our high standards.

Role

We are looking for a Technical Artist to join our internal game studio at Voodoo, working on Paper.io 2. As part of a small, agile team, you will bridge the gap between art and engineering, helping to optimize workflows, enhance visual quality, and ensure smooth performance across mobile platforms. Your work will directly impact the player experience in our high-performing genre-defining casual game.

  • Optimize game assets, shaders, and rendering pipelines for smooth performance on mobile devices.

  • Develop tools and scripts in Unity to streamline the workflow for artists and developers.

  • Work closely with game designers, artists, and developers to bring creative visions to life while maintaining technical efficiency.

  • Create and implement particle systems, shaders, and lighting techniques to enhance the game’s visual appeal.

  • Ensure asset optimization (compression, polygon count, texture sizes) & optimal import into Unity without sacrificing quality.

  • Debug and troubleshoot graphical and performance issues on different mobile devices.

  • Stay up to date with the latest trends and best practices in mobile game art and Unity development.

Profile

  • Experience: 5+ years as a Technical Artist in the mobile gaming industry

  • Strong Unity expertise, including shader development (Shader Graph/HLSL), particle systems, and rendering optimization

  • Proficiency in C# scripting for automating processes and enhancing tools

  • Understanding of mobile game constraints (performance, memory, draw calls, batching)

  • Experience with lighting, VFX, post-processing, and GPU profiling

  • Knowledge of 3D modeling , texturing workflows (Photoshop, Substance and experience with Maya, including MEL scripting and tooling)

  • Ability to debug and optimize art assets and rendering issues.

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits according to the country you reside

jobs.title: Agency Lead South Korea - BeReal
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About BeReal

At BeReal, we are dedicated to authenticity in social media. By encouraging users to share unfiltered moments, we foster genuine connections and celebrate real life. We are now an international team of 70+ and have 40M+ monthly active users. Backed by Voodoo, our team is fully focused on scaling BeReal into an iconic social network used by hundreds of millions.

Role

As Voodoo is integrating BeReal, the company is looking to grow its sales team around the world to drive ad sales to agencies and brands. As BeReal's Agency Lead, you will be responsible for designing and executing the local South Korean sales strategy by selling traditional and innovative ad inventory to key agencies.

You will leverage Voodoo's unique know-how in app monetization to establish new business for BeReal.

You will need extensive brand and agency contacts in South Korea at major Holdcos (Cheil Worldwide, Innocean Worldwide, HS Ad, Daehong Communications, etc) and independent local media agencies to succeed. These contacts should be decision makers for trading, social media and investment teams.

You need to have a deep knowledge of the digital advertising landscape and particularly the South Korean media agency ecosystem.

You will be also responsible for the long-term development of business relationships with these prospects.

  • Own your local agency strategy and roadmap.

  • Build awareness and adoption around BeReal offering with agencies through client presentations, conference attendance and networking events.

  • Combine new business development and sales skills with long-term relationship management.

  • Engage with senior agency executives to drive deal growth in the long-term.

  • Communicate effectively internally to coordinate resources (Ads Ops, Publishing Management, User acquisition, etc...) and effectively sell our inventory

Profile

  • You have 5 years+ of experience in digital ad sales in South Korea with an outstanding track record in selling ad products to Agencies.

  • Social media mobile experience is a strong plus.

  • You have a strong track record working with local media agencies and understanding the South Korean advertising ecosystem.

  • A high degree of creativity, self-motivation, and drive.

  • An expert in managing a portfolio of clients and understanding the mobile ecosystem in a way that you can respond thoroughly and persuasively to the client's needs and questions.

  • Fluency in Korean and English is required.

Senior Economy Designer – Puzzle Studios

Paris

About Voodoo :
Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team :
You will be part of one of Voodoo’s puzzle-focused studios, working on a new title that has already shown strong early traction and clear potential for growth. The project is currently in development with a prototype already tested, strong daily activity, and a soft launch planned for the coming months.

The team’s next priority is to turn promising early metrics into long-term retention and sustainable monetization, with the economy design playing a central role in this strategic shift.

Role :

  • Own the in-game economy across progression, currencies, reward systems, and monetization loops.

  • Analyze live data and design A/B tests to validate hypotheses, optimize economy systems, and maximize monetization.

  • Collaborate with game design, product, and analytics to align economy decisions with gameplay goals and business KPIs.

  • Proactively identify opportunities for growth and present clear recommendations to leadership.

  • Bring strong industry knowledge from puzzle, casual, midcore, or casino games to help elevate economy design practices.

Profile :

  • 3+ years of experience in game economy design or monetization, preferably in mobile free-to-play.

  • Proven track record in balancing live game economies and driving revenue growth.

  • Strong data/analytics background; fluent in economic modelling and relevant toolsets.

  • Excellent communication in English (written and spoken).

Soft skills :

  • Bonus-driven, ambitious, motivated by impact rather than fixed salary

  • Highly proactive, action-oriented, resilient

  • Collaborative and communicative, comfortable working cross-functionally

  • Organised and reliable, able to report effectively to management

  • Contract: Permanent

  • Swile lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% covered by Voodoo)

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. This position is Beijing-based.

Team

Join our dynamic publishing operations team as a Senior Game Developer, spearheading the support of Voodoo games' lifecycle for our partner studios around the world.

As a pivotal member of our team, you will play a crucial role in overseeing the day-to-day operations, driving strategic projects, and contributing to the continuous improvement of our internal gaming tech. You’ll work alongside with our Core teams dedicated to ensuring the success of Voodoo's game launches worldwide. The collaborative environment provides an opportunity to lead and mentor, influencing the direction of our operations. Based in Beijing, this exciting role demands adaptability, strong project management skills, and the ability to seamlessly navigate diverse technical challenges.

This role is office based (3 days onsite in Beijing/ 2 days remote). If you’re not afraid to face challenging problems every day and to be at the centre of all the games testing and scaling action, then this is the job for you!

Role

We are looking for a senior Unity C# Game Developer who has been a primary contributor to the Game architecture, Feature development, and design for several casual games. You will collaborate with a variety of experts: product managers, game artists, game developers, tech engineers, monetization managers, data analysts...

  • Work closely with small teams of Unity game developers and artists (both internal & external).

  • Implement game logic and systems in C# using Unity.

  • Adapt and work within an existing code base, enhancing its functionality, stability and performance

  • Provide guidance and share your expertise

  • Ensure timely delivery of high-quality results

Profile

  • Expertise in Unity/C#

  • Strong proficiency at troubleshooting Tech related issues and experience in web development

  • A critical thinker and a problem solver with a keen eye for identifying problems in workflows and processes (and driving them to a resolution)

  • An eagerness to develop new skills and explore new problem spaces on a daily basis (game development, marketing, legal)

  • Previous experience and exposure to the game production process (as part of a game dev studio or otherwise)

  • Real interest in Casual and Hybrid games

  • Creative and hacker mindset with a strong sense of ownership

  • Speak and write English & Chinese

• Best-in-class compensation

• Other benefits according to the country you reside

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

At BeReal, we are dedicated to authenticity in social media. By encouraging users to share unfiltered moments, we foster genuine connections and celebrate real life. We are now an international team of 60+ and have 30M+ monthly active users. Backed by Voodoo, our team is fully focused on scaling BeReal into an iconic social network used by hundreds of millions.

Role

We’ve built BeReal with a tiny technology team of world-class engineers and we intend to keep this mindset as we scale it to hundreds of millions of users. To achieve this, we ship new features faster than any other scaled social network while upgrading our infrastructure. We work in small teams of generalists and give each engineer high autonomy to make product related decisions.

  • Take ownership of our products modeling pipelines

  • Contribute to high modeling performance through insightful ideas and initiatives.

  • Build and deploy quickly scalable ML systems.

  • Promote good coding practices, rigor and good-quality work.

  • Engage with colleagues across the company to leverage new ideas and perspectives and demonstrate excellent communication to efficiently cooperate with product managers, teammates and stakeholders.

  • Deep dive into data to discover relevant insights.

  • Build a rich understanding of the BeReal product, the company strategy, our products and their fit within the company’s daily operations.

  • Be a team player by supporting your teammates and sharing with them your knowledge or new discoveries.

Profile

  • Extensive experience building machine learning systems

  • Strong background in building and optimizing recommendation algorithms

  • Extensive experience with Python, SQL and MLOps best practices

  • Cloud experience needed (ideally GCP but could be another cloud provider)

  • Airflow and DBT experience is a nice to have

  • Excellent Communication in English and French mandatory to liaise with both a tech and business audience.

  • You enjoy working in a team, learning new things, sharing knowledge

jobs.title: 3D Unreal Generalist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Growth team is a transversal entity aiming to maximize and deliver the potential of any mobile product. It combines user acquisition, creative content production, monetization, and the tech capabilities required to turn applications into global hits. With over 150 experts, we operate at the forefront of mobile marketing and ad tech across various types of games (hypercasual, hybrid, 100% IAP).

We’re looking for the first 3D Unreal Engine Generalist to join our high-performing Creative Marketing team focused on producing top-performing mobile ads for our hit games, especially Mob Control.

Role

You will be responsible for crafting visually compelling, gameplay-driven 3D ad creatives using Unreal Engine. From concept to final render, you'll have full ownership of the production pipeline.

You’ll also play a key role in translating gameplay logic, mechanics, and scene setups from Unity to Unreal and vice versa, contributing to a smoother, more efficient creative production process.

Challenges

  • Create eye-catching 3D mobile ad creatives that clearly communicate gameplay and drive performance

  • Build and animate complete scenes in Unreal Engine: characters, environments, VFX, lighting

  • Use Blueprint scripting and/or code (C++) to simulate gameplay logic, interactions, and camera behaviors

  • Translate and adapt ad concepts, animations, and logic originally developed in Unity into Unreal Engine and vice versa with high fidelity

  • Take ownership of the entire ad creation pipeline: from ideation and scene setup to rendering and final polish

  • Apply storytelling and visual clarity to highlight core gameplay loops within 20–30 second formats

  • Collaborate with Creative and UA teams to test, learn, and iterate quickly

Profile

  • Strong generalist skills in Unreal Engine: modeling, texturing, lighting, animation, and rendering

  • Proficient in Blueprint scripting and familiar with coding (C++ or similar) for scene logic and behavior

  • Previous experience with Unity and a solid understanding of both engines’ workflows and capabilities

  • Proven ability to recreate and adapt gameplay mechanics and sequences from Unity into Unreal

  • Skilled at producing short-form video content that communicates gameplay and engages players

  • Understanding of mobile ad performance metrics like CTR, CPI, and ROAS

  • Comfortable working with optimized assets and keeping performance constraints in mind

  • Experience with Blender, Niagara, Megascans, or motion capture workflows

Benefits

  • Competitive salary based on experience

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% covered by Voodoo)

  • Premium healthcare coverage with SideCare, 100% covered for you and your family

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

  • Remote days on Fridays

jobs.descriptionHtml:

Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. This position is only available fully remote within a +/- 2hr time difference with Paris.

Team

Join a small, agile team working on The Almanac—a smart puzzle app built to sharpen your mind and cut through brain rot. With elegant word and logic challenges, it's a daily habit that actually makes you smarter. You’ll grow fast and make a real impact on a product loved by thousands.

  • Lead the end-to-end design of intuitive, beautiful, and efficient user experiences

  • Ensure the product feels premium, smooth, and delightful

Profile

  • Figma expert

  • Founder mentality: proactive, hands-on, and ownership-driven

  • Obsessed with quality and attention to detail

  • Able to prototype, iterate quickly, and work in short feedback loops

  • Fluent in English

Benefits

competitive salary + performance bonus and other benefits according to the country you reside.

jobs.title: Staff Backend Engineer - Golang
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

You will be a part of a team of 5 engineers, working on the gaming backend platform. This team collaborates closely with all departments of the company, including Core Gaming, Live Gaming and Engineering & Data.

Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games. The Engineering & Data team builds innovative tech products and platforms to support the growth of their gaming and consumer apps.

This team is a crucial part of Voodoo’s transition from Hyper-Casual games to Hybrid, Casual & Mid-Core. The backend platform has helped big titles like Mob Control & Block Jam 3D achieve amazing growth. In the next phase of evolution, we want to scale this platform to our upcoming promising titles. The objective is to scale the most common features as well as develop new features based on studios'.

This is a hybrid role based in Paris office with Relocation Package

Role

You will work on the backend platform supporting highly scalable mobile games, played by millions of people every day. You will work closely with client-developers & game designers starting from feature design to delivery, validation, and iteration.

The responsibilities are cross-functional, ranging from infrastructure, API design & coding all the way to client-side integration(we are using Golang). To succeed in this role, you will need to have passion for everything you do. You love to write code that scales to millions of users, are skilled at requirements gathering, champion new tech initiatives & leverage existing solutions.

  • 7+ years of backend development experience

  • Strong knowledge of computer science fundamentals

  • Extreme fluency in Golang

  • Mastery of SQL and NoSQL

  • Background in high-scale systems

  • Understanding of Unix-like environments

  • Experience working in cross-functional agile teams

Profile

  • Strong analytical skills with a track record of solving complex problems related to scalability, performance, and integration in high-stakes environments.

  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, capable of influencing teams and interfacing effectively with various stakeholders.

  • Ability to be self sufficient and work autonomously.

  • A deep interest in game development is a plus.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary based on experience

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% covered by Voodoo)

  • Premium healthcare coverage with SideCare, 100% covered for you and your family

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps. With 7 billion downloads and over 200 million monthly active users, Voodoo is a leading mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads along with Google and Meta.

The company is one of the most impressive examples of hypergrowth in the ecosystem, backed by Goldman Sachs, Tencent, and GBL.

Voodoo is now a team of over 800 employees worldwide, we’re looking for talented individuals from across the globe to come and entertain the world with us.

We're looking for a Legal Intern in the Legal - Commercial & IP Department at Voodoo, running from January to July 2026

Team

Our Legal teams support the company’s performance and growth whilst putting people at the core of everything they do. As a French tech leader and global successful company, our Legal teams are constantly looking for ways to innovate and increase organization efficiency to keep Voodoo ahead of the market. Voodoo’s Corporate function is composed of five teams: HR, Talent acquisition, Legal, M&A and Finance, working together to drive Voodoo’s success.

You will be part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You will be part of a collaborative team that is ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and willing to go the extra mile.

Role

As a Legal Intern in the Commercial team, you will play a key role in supporting the operational teams by addressing their legal needs. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Managing IP protection and infringement issues, including trademark registrations, takedown requests, and pre-litigation or litigation cases in France and abroad.

  • Contributing actively to the company’s strategy to strengthen the protection of its games and apps in an evolving legal environment.

  • Drafting and reviewing various commercial agreements for publishing, marketing, and gaming teams. This includes publishing contracts, user acquisition and monetization agreements, service contracts, and partnership deals.

Profile

  • Fluency in English and French required

  • A first successful experience as intern in a law firm or in the legal commercial department of a company

  • Knowledge of IP law (copyright, trademarks, designs) is a plus

  • You master the Office Pack and demonstrate rigor, diplomacy and a sense of confidentiality

  • Sense of listening, availability, ability to work in a team, and a good sense of humor will be great assets for a successful journey at Voodoo !

Benefits

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% borne by Voodoo)

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

  • Remote days

Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Growth team is a transversal entity aiming to maximize and deliver the potential of any mobile product. It combines user acquisition, creative content production, monetization, and the tech capabilities required to turn applications into global hits. With over 150 experts, we operate at the forefront of mobile marketing and ad tech across various types of games (hypercasual, hybrid, 100% IAP) and apps.

Role

We’re looking for a Marketing Artist/Designer for BeReal’s Organic Social Channels. In this role, you’ll be designing content for our organic presence on Instagram and TikTok accounts which combine around 3M followers.

  • Work closely with the BeReal Social Media Lead to execute on content that will fill plans across all channels, contributing to the organic marketing strategy

  • Use your motion and design skills to create content curated per channel (ie TikTok, Instagram, BeReal itself)

  • Iteratively analyze performance of all social content to learn what is or is not working, adjusting your approach accordingly

  • You may have worked with influencer content in the past, and will be required to do so in this role

  • Big bonus if you are comfortable in front of the camera and you’re passionate about making social content (you may just end up on BeReal’s channels in front of millions!)

Profile

You are curious and adaptable, with an entrepreneurial mindset : a proactive go-getter who thrives in iterative marketing workflows, stays ahead of trends, and knows exactly what content works on TikTok versus Instagram.

  • Strong proficiency of After Effects : animation, project organization

  • Audio editing skills: sound enhancement, quick edits, and basic mixing

  • Video editing basics in Adobe Premiere : subtitles, quick cuts...

  • Good sense of organization & workflow, especially when working with templates

  • Photo editing proficiency (Photoshop and/or other)

  • Basic knowledge of Figma : exporting and creating simple visuals.

  • Familiarity with AI tools (Generative AI, 11Labs, Vocal Remover, ChatGPT)

  • CapCut knowledge is appreciated

  • Experience growing a significant personal online audience is a strong plus

Benefits

  • Competitive salary based on experience

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% covered by Voodoo)

  • Premium healthcare coverage with SideCare, 100% covered for you and your family

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

  • Remote days on Fridays

jobs.title: QA Engineer - Ratata Studio
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the largest and most successful hybrid publisher in the world.

You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on Uboat Attack, Infantry Attack, Sniper Siege, Walkers Attack.

Role

As a Quality Assistance Engineer at Voodoo, you will lead our approach to maintaining our game health and free of defects.

Together with the rest of the team, you will be in charge of testing the game and minimizing the number of defects in it:

  • Conduct comprehensive testing of our mobile games to identify and document crucial defects, taking ownership of the entire QA process to assure quality and user experience.

  • Assist in creating processes and tools to improve the overall quality of the game.

  • Follow the technical KPIs of our live games and propose strategies to continuously improve them.

  • Coordinate closely with design and development teams, understanding game mechanics and providing essential feedback to improve and refine the product.

  • Prioritize and execute testing tasks efficiently at different development stages, aligning with project timelines and objectives while independently addressing and resolving issues found.

  • Foster an open feedback culture, actively participating in constructive dialogue with team members to facilitate collaboration and innovation.

  • You regularly review the relevant KPIs to ensure the good health of the project, both the perception of our audience and performance-wise quality

  • Work with our central tech teams on quality-related initiatives.

  • Investigate production issues.

  • Conduct cross-platform manual testing: Android, iOS.

  • Work with in-house and external test tools.

Profile

  • 3+ years as a QA Engineer in Mobile Games, demonstrating ownership and successful project completion

  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to take up tasks from start to finish with little assistance and identify and address issues independently and effectively

  • Reliable self-starter and team player, capable of taking responsibility and contributing positively to team dynamics

  • Passion for mobile games with insight into the player's perspective and expectations

  • Proven experience using various testing tools and methodologies for mobile games

  • Clear communication skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas to various stakeholders effectively

  • Basic familiarity with SQL

  • Ability to read logs and identify critical information

  • Experience writing and working with test case documentation

  • Good understanding of Free-to-Play (F2P) games and game design principles and release management experience are a plus

  • Fluent English (speaking and writing)

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits according to the country you reside

jobs.title: QA Engineer - Wizz
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.


Team

Our consumer apps teams are at the forefront of crafting innovative and engaging apps for daily enjoyment. Our ambition extends beyond gaming to entertain a global audience. Millions of people around the world, especially in the US, download and use the apps we create.

You'll be working on Wizz, a social app specifically designed for teens, boasting over 3 million monthly active users in the US and UK. Wizz is a friend-finding and chat app where young people can safely express themselves and connect with like-minded peers in an authentic, pressure-free environment. Unlike other social media platforms that focus on followers, posts, or passive consumption, Wizz offers young people a space to have meaningful 1:1 conversations with peers.


As a member of a high-performing team of 20, you'll collaborate to further scale and enhance Wizz, fostering a spirit of goodwill and creativity. As Wizz continues its dynamic growth and development, we are seeking an ambitious Senior QA Engineer to join.


Role

As a QA Engineer at Wizz, you’ll be the go-to expert on product quality. You’ll ensure flawless releases and help the team deliver a smooth, high-performing app that delights our users.

  • Become a reference point for the product: master all its features and specifications

  • Design and maintain detailed, comprehensive test plans and cases

  • Implement QA best practices across the team

  • Build and run manual and automated test suites to ensure reliability

  • Estimate, prioritize, plan, and coordinate testing activities

  • Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and engineers to shape and adapt testing strategies

Profile

You’re a proactive, detail-oriented professional who takes ownership and thrives in fast-paced environments. You love digging into the details to ensure every user interaction feels seamless.

  • Solid experience testing mobile applications (iOS and Android)

  • Proven experience with automated testing tools and frameworks

  • Deep understanding of QA methodologies, tools, and processes

  • A hands-on, autonomous mindset, capable of owning tasks from start to finish

  • Excellent communication skills to collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams

  • Fluent in French and English

Benefits

  • Competitive salary upon experience

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% borne by Wizz)

  • Premium healthcare coverage SideCare, for your family 100% borne by Wizz

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

  • Unlimited vacation policy

  • Remote days on Mondays, Tuesdays and Fridays

We're a small team of excellent people who take care of everything from ideas to testing, and we intend to grow while maintaining our high standards.

jobs.descriptionHtml:

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Team

Our Growth team helps maximize the potential of each Voodoo product within the ecosystem. Our Growth team is split into several job expertise such as user acquisition, ad monetization, video ads, playable ads, and influencer marketers. Reporting to the Influencer Content Manager, this position requires a lot of operational excellence and creativity in order to constantly adapt ourselves to stay ahead of the rest of the market.

Role

As an Influencer Content Associate at Voodoo, you will play a key role in building and managing a network of influencers, creators, and actors to produce high-quality video ads for our social apps at scale. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Identifying high-potential creators across social media platforms.

  • Engaging and contracting creators, ensuring all agreements are properly formalized.

  • Developing creative briefs that align with the products you will serve and overseeing the execution of those briefs by your creators.

  • Assisting creators/actors with video production when necessary to ensure the quality and vision are met.

  • Handling video editing of created content to refine the produced videos.

  • Tracking and analyzing content performance, while building a CRM database of creators for future collaborations.

  • Reporting on production outputs and performance metrics, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.

  • Collaborating closely with Product, User Acquisition, and Creative teams to align influencer-produced content with product-specific needs and objectives.

  • Staying up-to-date with social media trends and competitor strategies to continuously discover and implement top-performing concepts.

  • Becoming an expert in User-Generated Content (UGC), ensuring your work stays relevant and innovative in a competitive landscape.

  • Note: The focus of your efforts will be on social apps like BeReal or Wizz.

Profile

  • 2-4 years of experience working with influencers or creators, with a strong understanding of the industry.

  • Experience in the mobile apps industry is preferred.

  • Data-driven and possess a structured, analytical mindset.

  • Creative and passionate about social media and driving user engagement.

  • Entrepreneurial mindset, adaptable to fast-paced environments with a proactive approach to problem-solving.

  • Proven ability to work effectively in teams, demonstrating strong collaboration and communication skills.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

This role is in the Blitz team, a gaming platform launched by Voodoo in 2021. Blitz is a mobile app focused on eSport competitions, allowing to play many games to enjoy, practice, and compete with other players. Blitz allows you to play various competitive modes, including 1v1 matches, tournaments, and high score events. Some games in the Blitz App can be accessed and played in “Cash Games”, requiring payment of an entry fee and giving access to real-money prizes.

Role

  • As a Social Media Manager Intern, you will be responsible for managing and growing Blitz’s public social media presence across Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, and TikTok.

  • Your goal is to create engaging content, interact with our community, and analyze performance metrics to optimize strategy and drive player engagement outside of the application.

Key Responsibilities

  • Content Creation – Develop and execute creative social media content (posts, videos, graphics, memes) aligned with Blitz’s brand and gaming culture

  • Online Engagement – Actively manage posts, respond to comments/messages, and foster meaningful interactions to strengthen player loyalty

  • Social Listening – Monitor player sentiment, trends, and discussions to identify opportunities for engagement and improvement

  • Data Analysis & Reporting – Track and interpret key performance metrics (engagement rates, follower growth, content reach) to refine strategies

  • Trend Spotting – Stay updated on the latest social media trends, viral content, and gaming industry insights to keep Blitz relevant and engaging

  • Collaboration – Work closely with the Marketing/ Growth, and LiveOps teams to align messaging and maximize campaign impact.

  • Paid Social Support – Assist in planning and optimizing paid social media campaigns for player acquisition and retention with the Growth team

Profile

  • Final-year student from a top business, marketing, or communication school, seeking an internship

  • Fluent in English

  • Passionate about mobile gaming, esports, and online communities

  • Strong interest in social media trends, content creation, and community management

  • Excellent copywriting, storytelling, and visual content skills

  • Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and optimize content performance

  • Proactive, creative, and detail-oriented with strong multitasking abilities

  • Familiarity with social media analytics tools, scheduling platforms, and content editing apps

Nice to have

  • Experience in startups, gaming, or fast-paced digital environments.

  • Knowledge of Canva, Figma, Adobe Suite, AI tools, and video editing software.

  • Understanding of SEO, influencer marketing, and paid social advertising

Blitz is a mobile app focused on eSport competitions, allowing to play many games to enjoy, practice, and compete with other players. Blitz allows you to play various competitive modes, including 1v1 matches, tournaments, and high score events. Some games in the Blitz App can be accessed and played in “Cash Games”, requiring payment of an entry fee and giving access to real-money prizes.

 - As a Social Media Manager Intern, you will be responsible for managing and growing Blitz’s public social media presence across Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, and TikTok.

 - Your goal is to create engaging content, interact with our community, and analyze performance metrics to optimize strategy and drive player engagement outside of the application.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Content Creation – Develop and execute creative social media content (posts, videos, graphics, memes) aligned with Blitz’s brand and gaming culture

 - Online Engagement – Actively manage posts, respond to comments/messages, and foster meaningful interactions to strengthen player loyalty

 - Social Listening – Monitor player sentiment, trends, and discussions to identify opportunities for engagement and improvement

 - Data Analysis & Reporting – Track and interpret key performance metrics (engagement rates, follower growth, content reach) to refine strategies

 - Trend Spotting – Stay updated on the latest social media trends, viral content, and gaming industry insights to keep Blitz relevant and engaging

 - Collaboration – Work closely with the Marketing/ Growth, and LiveOps teams to align messaging and maximize campaign impact.

 - Paid Social Support – Assist in planning and optimizing paid social media campaigns for player acquisition and retention with the Growth team


PROFILE

 - Final-year student from a top business, marketing, or communication school, seeking an internship

 - Fluent in English

 - Passionate about mobile gaming, esports, and online communities

 - Strong interest in social media trends, content creation, and community management

 - Excellent copywriting, storytelling, and visual content skills

 - Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and optimize content performance

 - Proactive, creative, and detail-oriented with strong multitasking abilities

 - Familiarity with social media analytics tools, scheduling platforms, and content editing apps


NICE TO HAVE

 - Experience in startups, gaming, or fast-paced digital environments.

 - Knowledge of Canva, Figma, Adobe Suite, AI tools, and video editing software.

 - Understanding of SEO, influencer marketing, and paid social advertising

jobs.title: Senior Data Analyst - Paper.io 2
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

This position can be Paris-based or full remote within CET time ±3h.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.

You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on Paper.io 2.

About us
We’re a small team of excellent people who handle everything, from ideas to testing and we’re growing fast while keeping our high standards. We avoid the obvious, value original thinking, and look for people who bring real personality and perspective to their work. That’s why we skip the usual technical checklist and focus on what really matters: the kind of person you are.

Role

  • Autonomously take ownership of the A/B testing cycle on Paper.io 2, validating feature values, refining key parameters, and optimizing monetization to drive core KPIs.

  • Lead analysis of large, complex datasets to uncover player behaviors and growth opportunities.

  • Translate data insights into clear, actionable recommendations that shape game design and the product roadmap.

  • Collaborate closely with designers, product managers, and developers to embed data-driven decisions throughout the game lifecycle.

  • Build and maintain dashboards and reports that keep the team aligned on critical metrics.

Profile

  • 4+ years in analytical roles within gaming, comfortable working with product teams.

  • Skilled in SQL and either R or Python; experience with complex, large datasets.

  • Strong grasp of A/B testing and statistical analysis methods.

  • Autonomous and pragmatic problem solver with a sharp analytical mind and attention to detail.

  • Thrives in fast-paced live-ops/product-driven environments with rapid iteration.

  • Creative thinker who challenges assumptions and sees beyond the obvious.

  • Player-first mindset with genuine interest in games and player behavior.

  • Excellent communicator who turns data into compelling, actionable stories.

  • Collaborative team player who adapts quickly to change and ambiguity.

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits based on your country of residence

jobs.title: Head of Marketing performance - Wizz
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Team

Wizz is a social app specifically designed for GenZ, boasting over 3 million monthly active users in the US and UK. Wizz is a friend-finding and chat app where young people can safely express themselves and connect with like-minded peers in an authentic, pressure-free environment. Unlike other social media platforms that focus on followers, posts, or passive consumption, Wizz offers young people a space to have meaningful 1:1 conversations with peers.

As a member of a high-performing team of 20, you'll collaborate to further scale and enhance Wizz, fostering a spirit of goodwill and creativity.

Role

As Head of Marketing Performance - you will be responsible for scaling Wizz worldwide, reporting to Wizz CEO and working closely with Voodoo’s central growth team.

Your role will be to cover all growth activities for the app, including building a small team of top performers. The ideal candidate is a data-driven leader with a structured mindset, a passion for growth, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment.

Key tasks

  • Build the growth strategy to scale Wizz’s user base. Drive the execution of all user acquisition channels (including performance marketing, product-led growth, offline activities, partnerships, PR, content production, influencer marketing, organic growth, community management, ASO and app store relationships)

  • Partner with cross-functional teams and product teams to ensure execution of the growth strategy and leverage resources effectively

  • Conduct systematic data analysis and leverage key metrics to measure channels performances, drive decision-making, prioritize growth initiatives and new opportunities.

  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and competitors’ growth strategies to identify innovative activations

Profile

  • You have at least 5 years of experience, and a proven track record in driving growth for consumer-facing digital product, preferably in social media or mobile apps

  • You already have proven experience working with C-level / executives

  • You preferably have some leadership experiences with the ability to inspire and manage small teams of top performing individual contributors

  • You understand the mobile growth ecosystem in detail as well as branding performance

  • You are a data-driven, growth hacker with an entrepreneurial mindset and can adapt to a high-paced environment

  • You can demonstrate excellent teamwork and collaboration skills

  • You are fluent in English and in French

jobs.title: Experienced Data Analyst - Growth
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

The Engineering & Data team builds innovative tech products and platforms to support the impressive growth of our gaming and consumer apps, keeping Voodoo at the forefront of the mobile industry. The team plays a key role in Voodoo’s long-term strategy, enabling both product diversification and a state-of-the-art growth engine to distribute and scale our apps. We design pragmatic solutions ranging from simple search optimizations to complex machine learning systems.

We are looking for an Experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about turning data into actionable insights, supporting decision-making, and working closely with stakeholders to drive growth. By joining this team, you will directly impact Voodoo’s marketing and monetization strategies and help scale our apps to hundreds of millions of users.

Role

As an Experienced Data Analyst in charge of the User Acquisition scope, you will:

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders and the Growth team to optimize marketing and monetization performance.

  • Analyze large, complex datasets representing the behavior of millions of online and mobile game players.

  • Develop dashboards and reports that foster a shared understanding of growth performance and key business metrics.

  • Contribute to building and improving data pipelines to meet evolving business needs.

  • Manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment, balancing detail and speed of execution.

Profile

  • 3+ years of experience in analytical roles, ideally within a fast-paced tech, gaming, or consumer app company.

  • Strong SQL skills and experience working with large datasets.

  • Hands-on experience with a modern visualization tool (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BI, Mixpanel).

  • Familiarity with DBT and Python is a plus.

  • Comfortable liaising with stakeholders, presenting insights clearly, and supporting business decision-making.

  • Knowledge of A/B testing and statistical analysis is an advantage.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary upon experience

  • Comprehensive relocation package (including visa support)

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% borne by Voodoo)

  • Premium healthcare coverage SideCare, for your family is 100% borne by Voodoo

  • Child day care facilities (Les Petits Chaperons rouges)

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

  • Unlimited vacation policy

  • Remote days

You'll be working on Wizz, a social app specifically designed for teens, boasting over 3 million monthly active users in the US and UK. Unlike other social media platforms that focus on followers, posts, or passive consumption, Wizz offers young people a space to have meaningful 1:1 conversations with peers.

As a member of a high-performing team of 20, you'll collaborate to further scale and enhance Wizz, fostering a spirit of goodwill and creativity. As Wizz continues its dynamic growth and development, we are seeking an ambitious Senior Backend Engineer to join.

Role

We are looking for :

  • A Senior Backend Engineer who is not only technically strong but also eager to contribute to the product vision and actively participate in decision-making. You won’t just be writing code, you’ll have a key role in shaping the architecture, scalability, and long-term strategy of Wizz. Your ability to think beyond execution and take ownership will be crucial: we want someone who is proactive, challenges assumptions, and collaborates with product and engineering teams to create a robust, scalable, and innovative platform.

Your mission:

  • Own the backend architecture, ensuring scalability, performance, and reliability for millions of users.

  • Collaborate closely with product teams to shape and influence product decisions with a strong technical perspective.

  • Design, implement, deploy, and maintain highly-scalable and available backend systems.

  • Define and promote best practices in reliability, observability, and infrastructure management.

  • Contribute to backend infrastructure evolution, ensuring that it supports rapid product iterations and growth.

  • Improve system performance and scalability, particularly around high-traffic distributed systems.

Our stack

  • Language and libraries: Node.js, Fastify, Socket.io, Go, Firebase

  • Databases: MongoDB, Redis

  • Infrastructure: Cloud Run, Pub/Sub, S3, CloudFront, Big Query

  • Ops: Github Action, AWS CLI, gcloud CLI, Docker, microservice architecture

  • iOS: XCode, GitHub, Cocoapods (public and private)

  • Be fluent in French

  • Excellent back-end programming skills (5+ years experience)

  • Interest in Node.JS (vanilla)

  • Professional GCP or AWS expertise 

  • Experience building APIs

  • Experience with high traffic and distributed systems architectures

  • Familiarity with services & technologies used in our Stack

  • Track record with a social media application is a plus

  • DevOps skills (Terraform, Cloud formation, …), are a plus

Benefits

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.

You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on Paper.io 2.

Role

  • Design and implement F2P systems that enhance player engagement and revenue, with a focus on progression, monetization, live events, and in-game economies.

  • Take full ownership of specifications, timelines, and outcomes, ensuring smooth execution and high-quality delivery.

  • Utilize A/B testing, retention metrics, and player data to refine and optimize features post-launch. Identify strengths, address weaknesses, and iterate for continuous improvement.

  • Collaborate closely with developers, artists, and analysts to ensure seamless feature rollouts. Maintain clear documentation, resolve technical challenges, and make strategic trade-offs to deliver the best possible player experience.

  • Prioritize development efforts under tight deadlines, balancing speed and quality to maximize impact.

  • Stay ahead of industry trends by monitoring competitors, analyzing market innovations, and rapidly adapting best practices.

Profile

  • 5+ years of experience in mobile F2P games in a Design role, specializing in live events, economy and live operations.

  • Skilled in roadmap planning, market analysis, and user research to identify opportunities and maximize business success.

  • A track record of shipping features and using data-driven decisions to improve and refine existing systems.

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits according to the country you reside
