jobs.title: Lead Economy Designer - Gear Fight
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

This position is Paris-based, with relocation support available.

Team

You will be an integral part of a newly established internal studio, a dynamic and focused team dedicated to one of our most promising prototype in scale. This studio is specifically chartered to improve this high-potential game up to the successful and market-ready title it is meant to become. 

In this exciting role, your initial focus will be on Cup Heroes! or Gear Fight!, two games that have already demonstrated significant promise and captured our attention with their compelling core mechanics and engaging gameplay.

Role

  • The goal of this role is to increase revenue streams and monetization depth, providing a long term vision

  • Continuously analyze in-game data to identify opportunities for optimizing and growing game economies

  • Create and maintain models of in-game economies, considering player progression, currency flow, and reward systems

  • Deliver designs of A/B tests to experiment with different economic models and features, analyzing results to implement the most effective solutions; Monitor test performance and iterate on strategies based on data-driven insights;

  • Drive close collaboration with Game Designers, Developers, and Analysts to align economic strategies with game design goals and clear KPIs that prove success;

  • Ensure that game economy models are scalable and adaptable to new game features or changes in player behavior;

  • Regularly present findings and recommendations to stakeholders, including the General Manager and Game Designers, to drive informed decision-making;

  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and competitor strategies in midcore games to identify opportunities for innovation and differentiation;

  • Apply industry best practices and learnings to enhance game monetization and player experiences.

Profile

  • 5+ years of experience as a Game Designer, including 2+ years as Game Economy Designer or Monetization Expert.

  • Experience working on mobile games and f2p, experience creating economy and monetization loops, and maintaining their balancing.

  • Strong mathematical or economic background, fluency in economic modelling and Excel/Google Sheets/relevant toolset.

  • Clear communication skills in English, both written and verbal; Clear and concise.

  • Entrepreneurial mindset essential.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary

  • Premium healthcare (SideCare) for you and your family 100% borne by Voodoo

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% borne by Voodoo)

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

  • Child daycare facilities (Les Petits Chaperons rouges)

jobs.title: Level Designer - Gear Fight
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

This position is Paris-based, with relocation support available.

Team

You will be an integral part of a newly established internal studio, a dynamic and focused team dedicated to one of our most promising prototype in scale. This studio is specifically chartered to improve this high-potential game up to the successful and market-ready title it is meant to become.

In this exciting role, your initial focus will be on Gear Fight!, a game that has already demonstrated significant promise and captured our attention with its compelling core mechanics and engaging gameplay. You'll have the opportunity to contribute directly to the growth and refinement of Gear Fight!, leveraging its existing traction to build a truly exceptional player experience. This is a unique chance to join a project with established momentum while still having a significant impact on its future direction within a dedicated and agile studio environment

Role

We’re seeking a data-informed and highly analytical Level Designer who is passionate about building scalable puzzle systems. You are not just a creator of levels, but an architect of the player's journey through the content. You will be laser-focused on designing and balancing the feel and challenge of the levels that can entertain millions of players for the long term. As the driving force behind the game's level-based progression, you'll leverage both creative design and quantitative insights to ensure Gear Fight becomes our next global hit.

  • Balance the game's long-term difficulty curve across chapters, missions, and waves to manage player pacing, challenge, and skill progression.

  • Own the player's content journey from a holistic perspective, defining how and when new mechanics, enemies, and interactive elements are introduced to maintain long-term interest.

  • Documentation - Document level designs using diagrams, flowcharts, and spreadsheets to communicate your concepts effectively within the team

  • Collaborate to Create: Ensure your designs adhere to technical constraints and opportunities presented by our game engine, while working closely with our team of artists, animators, and programmers to ensure your level designs are fully realized.

  • Collaborate closely with key stakeholders - General Manager, Game Design Director & Product Managers to seamlessly integrate monetization and reward systems into the level progression, ensuring they feel natural and value-additive to the player experience.

  • Utilize player feedback, analytics and A/B testing frameworks to rigorously evaluate level performance. You will be expected to interpret data to identify points of friction, re-balance content, and validate your design hypotheses.

  • Design levels that intuitively teach game mechanics through gameplay, reducing the reliance on explicit tutorials and fostering a sense of discovery for the player.

Profile

  • At least 3 years of experience in Level Design on a successful live-operated F2P casual puzzle game.

  • Deep understanding of F2P mobile game economies, player progression systems, and retention strategies.

  • Proven experience using analytics and A/B testing to make data-driven design decisions. Your portfolio should not only show final levels but also demonstrate your process, such as balancing spreadsheets, difficulty modeling, or case studies of data-informed improvements.

  • A systems-thinking approach; you must be able to articulate how a new mechanic or level element will impact game balance, the economy, and player psychology on a systemic level.

  • Strong experience or deep knowledge of Tower Defense and/or light RPG mechanics, particularly concerning unit balance, strategic placement, and progression systems

  • A degree in game design, computer science, or a related field would be beneficial.

  • An experience or knowledge of Tower Defense or RPG games is a plus.

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits according to the country you reside.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

You will be an integral part of a newly established internal studio, a dynamic and focused team dedicated to one of our most promising prototype in scale. This studio is specifically chartered to improve this high-potential game up to the successful and market-ready title it is meant to become.

In this exciting role, your initial focus will be on Gear Fight! , Cup Heroes or Monster Survivors games already has demonstrated significant promise and captured our attention with their compelling core mechanics and engaging gameplay.

Role

  • Act as a trusted advisor on all things data, establishing best practices for data collection, analysis, and reporting.

  • Lead the analysis of large, complex datasets to understand player behavior and identify opportunities for growth in engagement, retention, and monetization.

  • Translate data insights into clear recommendations to inform game design, feature development, and the overall product roadmap.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with game designers, product managers, and developers to ensure data-driven strategies are embedded throughout the game’s lifecycle.

  • Design, build, and maintain automated dashboards and reports, ensuring the entire team has access to critical metrics and insights.

  • Utilize A/B testing to evaluate and optimize game features and mechanics, driving measurable improvements in key performance indicators.

Profile

  • At least 4 years of analytical work experience in the gaming, tech or a data-driven industry, with a proven track record working in close connection with product teams.

  • Proficient with SQL and either R or Python, with a proven experience working with large and complex data sets.

  • Good knowledge of statistical analysis and concepts used for industry-standard methods like AB testing or forecasting.

  • Autonomous person with a strong analytical mind, problem-solving skills and strong attention to detail.

  • Ability to understand a business problem, turn it into an analytics/statistics problem and solve it using adequate methods.

  • Highly pragmatic mindset with the ability to quickly identify what needs to be focused on and what can be considered of lower priority.

  • Capacity to be the pro-active owner of the entire data chain for your game.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary

  • Premium healthcare (SideCare) for you and your family 100% borne by Voodoo

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% borne by Voodoo)

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

  • Child daycare facilities (Les Petits Chaperons rouges)

jobs.title: Head of Growth - Wizz
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Team

Wizz is a social app specifically designed for GenZ, boasting over 3 million monthly active users in the US and UK. Wizz is a friend-finding and chat app where young people can safely express themselves and connect with like-minded peers in an authentic, pressure-free environment. Unlike other social media platforms that focus on followers, posts, or passive consumption, Wizz offers young people a space to have meaningful 1:1 conversations with peers.

As a member of a high-performing team of 20, you'll collaborate to further scale and enhance Wizz, fostering a spirit of goodwill and creativity.

Role

As Head of Growth - you will be responsible for scaling Wizz worldwide, reporting to Wizz CEO and working closely with Voodoo’s central growth team.

Your role will be to cover all growth activities for the app, including building a small team of top performers. The ideal candidate is a data-driven leader with a structured mindset, a passion for growth, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment.

Key tasks

  • Build the growth strategy to scale Wizz’s user base. Drive the execution of all user acquisition channels (including performance marketing, product-led growth, offline activities, partnerships, PR, content production, influencer marketing, organic growth, community management, ASO and app store relationships)

  • Partner with cross-functional teams and product teams to ensure execution of the growth strategy and leverage resources effectively

  • Conduct systematic data analysis and leverage key metrics to measure channels performances, drive decision-making, prioritize growth initiatives and new opportunities.

  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and competitors’ growth strategies to identify innovative activations

Profile

jobs.title: Strategic Finance & Data Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Corporate teams support the company’s performance and growth whilst putting people at the core of everything they do. As a French tech leader and global successful company, our Corporate teams are constantly looking for ways to innovate and increase organization efficiency to keep Voodoo ahead of the market. Voodoo’s Corporate function is composed of five teams: HR, Talent acquisition, Legal, M&A and Finance (20 people) working together to drive Voodoo’s success.

We are looking for a Strategic Finance & Data Analyst with a solid financial, modelling and data analysis background to help the company:

  • Evaluate and understand its projected financial performance in a fast-growing business.

  • Model business cases on various ad hoc financial matters.

You will be part of a high-performing team of 7 people under the supervision of an experienced FP&A & Data Manager and will have the opportunity to grow your skills.

Role

Forecasting

  • Collect, select and analyze financial and operational data

  • Develop and Maintain internal data models based on highly granular data to prepare monthly forecasts of the Gross Margin

  • Collaborate closely with finance and business stakeholders to collect, model, and interpret financial and operational data, ensuring accuracy and relevance in all planning activities

  • Identify and implement process improvements to automate data analysis where possible

  • Communicate outputs of data-driven analysis in a clear, concise, and actionable manner to stakeholders at all levels

Other Corporate Finance matters

  • Build, update, and refine financial models for ad hoc requests such as incentive plans, business cases/ROI analysis for potential new strategic projects or M&A investments,...

  • Collaborate across teams (product, legal, HR, leadership) to capture data and translate it into actionable recommendations.

  • Respond to ad hoc analytical requests with creative, high-quality solutions under tight deadlines.

  • Participate in corporate projects (Fund raising, Integration of acquired companies …)

Profile

  • Master’s degree in Finance, Engineering, or related field, 4-5 years of experience in valuation and business modeling or transaction services (large company or Big 4 background preferred).

  • Strong analytical skills and proven experience in financial analysis and modeling (expert in Excel; Power BI/Power Query a plus).

  • Fluent in French and English.

  • Organized, detail-oriented, and able to prioritize effectively.

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% covered by Voodoo)

  • Premium healthcare coverage with SideCare, 100% covered for you and your family

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

  • Remote Mondays and Fridays

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

At WeMoms, we understand the complexities of motherhood. More than an app, we're a guiding compass for mothers globally, making motherhood feel intuitive and supported. Our vision is to create an ever-present circle of trust, wisdom, and support for every mom. We deliver personalized, empowering guidance and resources to mothers at every stage of their journey.

Our partnership with Voodoo, a global leader in mobile gaming and apps, propels us on a hyper growth path.  We are a passionate team of 30 professionals. As we embark on this exciting growth phase, we're looking for talented individuals to join us in shaping the future of motherhood support.

If you're driven to make a real difference in mothers' lives and thrive in a rapidly growing tech environment, we invite you to be part of our journey. Help us entertain and support the world, one mother at a time.

Role

WeMoms is looking to grow its sales team in France to drive ad sales to agencies and brands. As WeMoms’ Sales Manager, you will be responsible for designing and executing the sales strategy by selling traditional and innovative ad inventory to key brands.

Key Responsibilities

  • Identify, source, pitch, define, negotiate, close, and manage digital advertising revenue

  • Build awareness and adoption around WeMoms offering with client presentations, conference attendance and networking events.

  • Combine new business development and sales skills with long-term relationship management.

  • Engage with small and mid-market clients to drive deal growth in the long-term.

  • Communicate effectively internally to coordinate resources (Ads Ops, Account managers etc...) and effectively sell our inventory

  • Fluent in French, a good level of english is a plus

Profile

  • You have 7+ years of experience in digital ad sales with an outstanding track record in selling ad products to final clients.

  • Social media mobile experience is a strong plus.

  • You have a strong track record for outbound lead generation and business development.

  • A high degree of creativity, self-motivation, and drive.

  • An expert in managing a portfolio of clients and understanding the mobile ecosystem in a way that you can respond thoroughly and persuasively to the client’s needs and questions.

Team

Blitz is a gaming platform launched by Voodoo in 2021, allowing players to compete on mobile games for real cash prizes (head-up, tournaments, leagues, etc.). It is leveraging Voodoo’s unique game portfolio to engage users in a fun and rewarding way.

We're looking for Payment & Fraud Lead to join our team at Blitz, working with Camil Haroune, our COO.

Role

In this role, you'll be driving product oriented strategy and execution for our real money gaming platform, focusing on payments, fraud prevention, and user engagement systems.

  • Drive strategic initiatives to accelerate business growth and operational efficiency

  • Design and implement automated systems to streamline internal processes and enhance team productivity

  • Manage and optimize the payment infrastructure to ensure system stability, scalability, and performance

  • Develop and execute comprehensive fraud prevention strategies leveraging advanced data analytics

  • Oversee customer support operations and deliver ongoing process improvements

  • Handle legal and financial matters related to business operations in collaboration with relevant teams

  • Conduct in-depth data analysis to extract actionable insights and track key performance indicators

  • Build and maintain strong relationships with cross-functional teams to ensure aligned and effective project execution

  • Create and implement scalable solutions to address operational challenges and support company growth

  • Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field

  • Strong technical background with ability to work closely with engineering teams

  • Previous experience with payment systems, fraud prevention, or financial product

  • Understanding of mobile app development and gaming industry dynamics is a plus

  • English and French proficiency

  • Excellent communication skills with ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and take ownership of product outcomes

  • Experience working in fast-paced startup or scale-up environments

  • Swile Lunch voucher

jobs.title: Product Designer - BeReal
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About BeReal

At BeReal, we are dedicated to authenticity in social media. By encouraging users to share unfiltered moments, we foster genuine connections and celebrate real life. We are now an international team of 70+ and have 40M+ monthly active users. Backed by Voodoo, our team is fully focused on scaling BeReal into an iconic social network used by hundreds of millions.

Role

BeReal’s product team is a small group of high-performers reporting directly to the CEO. We operate at the intersection of data science, engineering, design, and operations. Highly autonomous and skilled across multiple areas, each member of the team is expected to identify opportunities, design high-impact solutions, drive implementation, and assess results.

  • Conduct qualitative and quantitative research of user behavior and needs. Identify key problems and opportunities

  • Propose pragmatic solutions and estimate business impact.

  • Contribute to prioritizing initiatives.

  • From wire-framing to designing end-to-end flows and prototypes, design features that solve problems in a simple and elegant way while taking care of every small detail.

  • Identify key metrics your solutions should improve and take ownership for achieving success.

  • Implement, test, and iterate with the technical team.

  • Contribute to building and improving our design system.

Profile

  • You’re passionate about scaling social consumer apps.

  • You’re plugged into GenZ’s drives and desires. You’re obsessed with understanding user needs in detail.

  • You’re highly driven, autonomous, and results-oriented.

  • You can both hack together a quick prototype and implement a scalable design system.

  • You love making delightful features but also are super pragmatic about having a substantial business impact.

  • You understand the technical implications of your design decisions.

  • You are fluent in English

Benefits

  • Competitive salary upon experience

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% borne by Voodoo)

  • Premium healthcare coverage SideCare, for your family is 100% borne by Voodoo

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

At BeReal, we are dedicated to authenticity in social media. By encouraging users to share unfiltered moments, we foster genuine connections and celebrate real life. We are now an international team of 70+ and have 40M+ monthly active users. Backed by Voodoo, our team is fully focused on scaling BeReal into an iconic social network used by hundreds of millions.

Role

BeReal’s product team is a small group of high-performers reporting directly to the CEO. We operate at the intersection of data science, engineering, design, and operations. Highly autonomous and skilled across multiple areas, each member of the team is expected to identify opportunities, design high-impact solutions, drive implementation, and assess results.

  • Conduct qualitative and quantitative research of user behavior and needs. Identify key problems and opportunities

  • Propose pragmatic solutions and estimate business impact.

  • Contribute to prioritizing initiatives.

  • From wire-framing to designing end-to-end flows and prototypes, design features that solve problems in a simple and elegant way while taking care of every small detail.

  • Identify key metrics your solutions should improve and take ownership for achieving success.

  • Implement, test, and iterate with the technical team.

  • Contribute to building and improving our design system.

Profile

  • You’re passionate about scaling social consumer apps.

  • You’re plugged into GenZ’s drives and desires. You’re obsessed with understanding user needs in detail.

  • You’re highly driven, autonomous, and results-oriented.

  • You can both hack together a quick prototype and implement a scalable design system.

  • You love making delightful features but also are super pragmatic about having a substantial business impact.

  • You understand the technical implications of your design decisions.

  • You are fluent in English

jobs.title: Senior Unity SDK Developer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Game Tech team builds scalable, reliable, and developer-friendly solutions for our studios. Our SDKs support various functionalities including Ad Network integration, privacy compliance, in-app purchases, Offers & Store, and more. We also manage a platform for Experimentation and Remote Configuration, alongside Gaming Backend to support multiplayer functionalities.

Role

You will join our SDK team of 10 dedicated developers and an engineering manager. Your role will involve driving the team towards technical excellence and ensuring our SDK empowers developers across our studios to create engaging gaming experiences for millions worldwide.

  • Design, develop, and maintain SDKs for Unity platform integration

  • Create clear documentation and sample implementations for SDK users

  • Collaborate with game developers to understand their needs and optimize SDK performance

  • Troubleshoot and resolve complex issues

  • Ensure SDK compatibility across different Unity versions and platforms

  • Implement best practices for performance optimization

  • Participate in code reviews and architectural decisions

  • This position can be remote, open to candidates based in Europe (GMT+1 ).

Profile

  • 8+ years of professional experience in game development

  • Strong proficiency in Unity and C#

  • Strong knowledge of software design patterns and architecture

  • Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills

  • Strong interest in developing SDKs

  • Experience with performance profiling and optimization tools

  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines

  • Passion for Gaming: A deep interest in game development and commitment to delivering high-quality tools that enable developers to create engaging games

  • Communication: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, capable of influencing teams and interfacing effectively with various stakeholders.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary upon experience

  • Comprehensive relocation package (including visa support)

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% borne by Voodoo)

  • Premium healthcare coverage SideCare, for your family is 100% borne by Voodoo

  • Child day care facilities (Les Petits Chaperons rouges)

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

  • Unlimited vacation policy

  • Remote days

jobs.title: Lead Game Designer - Mob Control
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.

You will join Mob Control, key title of Voodoo, with more than 230M installs and 14 MAU.

Role

As a Lead Game Designer for Mob Control, you will be a key owner of the product's vision, execution and strategic direction. Your mission is to help evolve the game, with the ultimate goal of turning Mob Control into a top-performing title in the midcore game market.

  • Design features & systems: Create new core loops and meta systems to drive engagement, social dynamics, and monetization. Develop design docs, user flows, and economy models, and propose A/B test ideas.

  • Evolve gameplay: Introduce new units and gameplay elements to refresh Mob Control, ensuring accessibility, fun, and monetization-friendly design.

  • Collaborate across teams: Partner with product managers, engineers, and artists to bring features from concept to live release, aligning gameplay, UX, and visuals.

  • Leverage player insights: Analyze KPIs and player behavior to inform design choices and identify opportunities to boost retention, engagement, and IAP monetization.

Profile

  • 5+ years of experience in mobile midcore games (strategy, 4X, or similar); 10+ years is a strong plus.

  • Proven track record in gameplay design, balancing, and meta feature design.

  • Experienced in contributing to the overall game vision and strategy.

  • Strong skills in creating clear, simple design documentation.

  • Ability to absorb and apply feedback from multiple sources with flexibility and no ego.

  • Skilled at simplifying and communicating complex systems.

  • Comfortable analyzing KPIs and player behavior to guide design decisions.

  • Passion for mobile midcore games and deep knowledge of market dynamics.

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits according to the country you reside

jobs.title: Data Analyst - China
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

You will join a dynamic, new team in China dedicated to collaborating closely with our Asian and Chinese studios. Your initial focus will be on a slate of promising midcore games from China, chosen for their compelling core mechanics and engaging gameplay. Our goal is to transform these games into successful, market-ready hits.

Role

  • Act as a trusted advisor on all things data, establishing best practices for data collection, analysis, and reporting.

  • Lead the analysis of large, complex datasets to understand player behavior and identify opportunities for growth in engagement, retention, and monetization.

  • Translate data insights into clear recommendations to inform game design, feature development, and the overall product roadmap.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with game designers, product managers, and developers to ensure data-driven strategies are embedded throughout the game’s lifecycle.

  • Design, build, and maintain automated dashboards and reports, ensuring the entire team has access to critical metrics and insights.

  • Utilize A/B testing to evaluate and optimize game features and mechanics, driving measurable improvements in key performance indicators.

Profile

  • At least 2 years of analytical work experience in the gaming, tech or a data-driven industry, with a proven track record working in close connection with product teams.

  • Proficient with SQL and either R or Python, with a proven experience working with large and complex data sets.

  • Good knowledge of statistical analysis and concepts used for industry-standard methods like AB testing or forecasting.

  • Extensive gaming background with a deep understanding of product design.

  • Autonomous person with a strong analytical mind, problem-solving skills and strong attention to detail.

  • Ability to understand a business problem, turn it into an analytics/statistics problem and solve it using adequate methods.

  • Highly pragmatic mindset with the ability to quickly identify what needs to be focused on and what can be considered of lower priority.

  • Capacity to be the pro-active owner of the entire data chain for your game.

  • Working proficiency in both English and Chinese.

Benefits

• Other benefits according to the country you reside

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

You will join a dynamic, new team in China dedicated to collaborating closely with our Asian and Chinese studios. Your initial focus will be on a slate of promising midcore games from China, chosen for their compelling core mechanics and engaging gameplay. Our goal is to transform these games into successful, market-ready hits.

Role

  • The goal of this role is to increase revenue streams and monetization depth, providing a long term vision

  • Continuously analyze in-game data to identify opportunities for optimizing and growing game economies

  • Create and maintain models of in-game economies, considering player progression, currency flow, and reward systems

  • Deliver designs of A/B tests to experiment with different economic models and features, analyzing results to implement the most effective solutions; Monitor test performance and iterate on strategies based on data-driven insights;

  • Drive close collaboration with Game Designers, Developers, and Analysts to align economic strategies with game design goals and clear KPIs that prove success;

  • Ensure that game economy models are scalable and adaptable to new game features or changes in player behavior;

  • Regularly present findings and recommendations to stakeholders, including the General Manager and Game Designers, to drive informed decision-making;

  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and competitor strategies in midcore games to identify opportunities for innovation and differentiation;

  • Apply industry best practices and learnings to enhance game monetization and player experiences.

Profile

  • 3+ years of experience as a Midcore Game Designer, including 2+ years as Game Economy Designer or Monetization Expert;

  • Experience working on midcore mobile games and f2p, experience creating economy and monetization loops, and maintaining their balancing;

  • Strong mathematical or economic background, fluency in economic modeling and Excel/Google Sheets/relevant toolset

  • Clear communication skills in English & Chinese, both written and verbal; Clear and concise.

  • Entrepreneurial mindset essential;

Benefits

• Best-in-class compensation and other benefits according to the country you reside

jobs.title: Product Marketing Director - Mob Control
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.

You will join Mob Control, key title of Voodoo, with more than 230M installs and 14 MAU.

Role

As Product Marketing Director for Mob Control, you will own the game’s market positioning, growth strategy and the onboarding of new users. You will also be a key participant in the broader game strategy and vision. Your mission is to deeply understand our players and the market to optimize product-market fit and drive sustained growth to keep evolving Mob Control into a top title in its category.

  • Develop and oversee Growth strategy: Deeply understand Mob Control and our positioning in the market to define the most appropriate UA/creatives strategy in collaboration with the Growth leaders.

  • Generate market & player insights: Generate player and market insights by combining internal data, market research, and direct observation of players.

  • Define IP positioning and messaging: Collaborate with the studio to define the game’s IP and brand identity to highlight the game’s USPs and better support our Growth strategy.

  • Contribute to the game’s strategy and roadmap: Using the combined vision over both the product and growth teams, contribute to building the product roadmap, with a special focus on the game onboarding.

  • Drive UA growth: Partner with the UA team to improve campaign performance by providing deep product and market insights that guide creative and targeting strategies.

  • Improve early retention and monetisation: Participate in the product roadmap with initiatives that better connect the onboarding to our creatives/UA and improve its efficiency to retain new installs.

  • Align Product and Growth: Bridge the two teams by acting as a clear point of contact that speaks the language of both teams, contributing to a better alignment.

Profile

  • Degree from a top-tier engineering or business school (or equivalent)

  • Proven experience in product marketing strategy, performance marketing/UA, ideally in mobile gaming or adjacent industries.

  • Ability to bridge product and growth, aligning UA, creatives, and product roadmap to drive acquisition, early retention, monetization, market insights

  • Solid understanding of player insights, onboarding (FTUE), ASO, and creative strategy; experience with CRM, content, branding, or social media is a strong plus.

  • Background as Product Marketing Manager, top consulting strategy, into a direct to consumer business o with strong commercial and analytical focus.

  • Self-motivated, critical thinker, and strong communicator able to collaborate with both product and growth teams.

  • Passion for gaming and ability to develop a long-term vision for scaling a game and building an IP.

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits according to the country you reside

jobs.title: Senior Technical Artist - Mob Control
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

This position is fully remote CET ±2h or Barcelona-based.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.

You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on Mob Control.

With Mob Control, we’re building an iconic game that players will never forget!

We're a small team of excellent people who take care of everything from ideas to testing, and we intend to grow while maintaining our high standards.

Role

We are about to make a big leap forward to push Mob Control into the next level, and you might be the chosen one, Neo.

You’ll play a key role in the upcoming evolution of Mob Control, a mobile game with over 400 million downloads.

As a Senior Technical Artist, you’ll bridge the gap between art and engineering, designing scalable UI/UX systems, building stylized shaders, and solving creative challenges that directly impact gameplay and player experience.

We’re looking for a hybrid profile: someone with strong artistic fundamentals and enough technical experience to bring modular, visually stunning systems to life in Unity. You’ll collaborate closely with game designers, developers, and artists in a fast-paced LiveOps environment, contributing to one of the world’s most played mobile games.

What you’ll do:

  • Design and implement modular and reusable UI/UX systems (cards, popups, banners, upgrades, etc.).

  • Create custom shaders and materials (2D/3D) for characters, environments, and UI elements.

  • Build tween-based animation systems and shader-based responsive feedback fx.

  • Support gameplay teams with technical visual solutions and FX that enhance readability and impact.

  • Develop and integrate screen-space FX and postprocessing effects for menus and gameplay.

  • Contribute to VFX design for in-game actions, events, and player feedback.

  • Prototype and maintain tools to streamline art production and optimize pipelines.

  • Create basic 3D models or animations as placeholder content when needed.

Profile

  • 6+ years of experience in game development, ideally in mobile or stylized GaaS titles.

  • Proven track record across full production cycles (from pre-production to LiveOps).

  • Strong grasp of visual design principles: color, form, contrast, timing, motion.

  • Solid Unity experience: uGUI, Shader Graph or Amplify, Animation and Timeline systems.

  • Experience creating stylized shaders for VFX and gameplay.

  • Familiarity with editor tools and custom inspectors in Unity.

  • Proficiency in 2D/3D tools like Photoshop, Illustrator, Blender, or Maya.

Nice to have:

  • Experience in high-volume LiveOps pipelines with frequent content updates.

  • A strong portfolio of stylized UI/UX, VFX, or technical art systems.

  • Passion for solving creative problems through smart, scalable technical workflows.

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits according to the country you reside

jobs.title: Experienced Analytics Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Do you have a passion for data analysis and a desire to elevate it to new heights? Join our close-knit Analytics Engineering team, where we ensure the data warehouse performs optimally, meeting and surpassing SLAs for maximum efficiency. We empower analysts by streamlining queries and maintaining a scalable, consistent repository. With custom CI processes, we minimize production hiccups, and our specialized tools around DBT boost analysts' confidence, enabling rapid and accurate data-driven decisions. Be part of a team that champions innovation and speed in the ever-evolving world of data.

Role

  • Take a proactive stance in solving data challenges to enhance platform performance, consistency, and accuracy.

  • Design, maintain, and refine scalable data models to support business applications and analytics, with an eye for adapting to evolving data needs.

  • Work with autonomy to address significant company-wide issues and develop solutions that span across teams.

  • Acquire a product understanding of our games and build data pipelines to promote new data analytics use cases.

  • Maintain comprehensive documentation to support effective project management and collaboration.

  • Advocate for a strong data quality culture to enable faster, more reliable decision-making.

  • Keep up-to-date with the latest data technologies and methodologies ensuring our team remains at the forefront of data engineering, data visualization, data tools, and infrastructure innovation.

Profile

  • Engineering/Computer Science background with solid experience in crafting complex, optimized SQL queries and a solid understanding of data modeling and data warehousing principles (3 years minimum)

  • Solid experience with the modern data stack, particularly DBT Core, Redshift (or equivalent), git, and Tableau (or equivalent), is necessary.

  • Experience with CI/CD, Airflow and Docker.

  • Terraform, K8s and ArgoCD are a plus.

  • Excellent communication skills, with ability to understand and communicate on both business or technical topics. English is mandatory

  • A pragmatic approach to balancing technical integrity with the need to accelerate delivery.

Our Stack

  • AWS (S3, Glue, Athena)

  • Infra as code: Terraform

  • CI/CD: CircleCI

  • Lakehouse: Iceberg with SparkSQL and Athena

  • Orchestration: dbt Core, Airflow (MWAA)

  • Observability: Elementary, in-house volume and freshness anomaly detection

  • Data Catalog: Open Metadata

  • Data Visualisation: Tableau, Redash

Benefits

  • Competitive salary based on experience

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% covered by Voodoo)

  • Premium healthcare coverage with SideCare, 100% covered for you and your family

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

jobs.title: Head of Marketing - New Games
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

As part of Voodoo Gaming, we partner with studios to build games from initial concept to global launch, aiming to create the next wave of iconic, chart-topping hybrid-casual hits. With over eight billion downloads and counting, Voodoo is the world’s largest and most successful hybrid-casual publisher.

Role

As Head of Marketing for New Games, you will define and drive the holistic marketing strategy to scale our upcoming titles. Acting as the bridge between Product and Growth, you will shape campaigns, brand positioning, and player acquisition strategies to maximize impact. Your mission is to combine data-driven insights with creativity to build sustainable growth and long-term value for our games.

  • Bridge Product & Growth: Act as the key link between Core teams and Growth, defining campaign strategy, budget allocation, forecasts, and long-term brand opportunities

  • Own holistic marketing strategy: Partner with GMs to shape and execute a 360° marketing vision covering UA, creatives, creator strategy, ASO, CRM, brand, and community initiatives.

  • Guide UA & Creative direction: Provide strategic guidance to UA and Creative teams, ensuring campaigns, assets, and content align with product vision and growth goals.

  • Scale new games: Develop and execute marketing strategies that support the game’s scale-up, from onboarding and FTUE optimization to multi-channel growth (organic, paid, social, influence).

  • Leverage player & market insights: Use data, research, and player understanding to identify opportunities for acquisition, retention, monetization, and long-term brand building.

  • Partner cross-functionally: Collaborate closely with Product, UA, and Creative stakeholders, acting as the “marketing right-hand” to GMs while aligning with central Growth leadership.

Profile

  • Degree from a top-tier engineering or business school (or equivalent)

  • Proven experience in a fast paced environment (consulting, start-up, agency) with exposure to performance marketing or strategic planning.

  • Strong strategic mindset: more strategist than operator, able to design long-term marketing roadmaps and brand positioning.

  • Data-driven and analytical, comfortable with forecasting, budget planning, and interpreting performance data to guide decisions.

  • Creative thinker with the ability to shape campaigns, brand identity, and player-facing initiatives.

  • Skilled communicator in English, able to align cross-functional teams and influence stakeholders at different levels.

  • Hands-on, proactive, and adaptable — a true “doer” able to balance strategy with execution when needed.

  • Passion for games and ability to envision marketing strategies that connect product features, content, and brand development over several years.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary

  • Premium healthcare (SideCare) for you and your family 100% borne by Voodoo

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% borne by Voodoo)

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

  • Child daycare facilities (Les Petits Chaperons rouges)

jobs.title: Client Partner South Korea - BeReal
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About BeReal

At BeReal, we are dedicated to authenticity in social media. By encouraging users to share unfiltered moments, we foster genuine connections and celebrate real life. We are now an international team of 70+ and have 40M+ monthly active users. Backed by Voodoo, our team is fully focused on scaling BeReal into an iconic social network used by hundreds of millions.

Role

As Voodoo is integrating BeReal, the company is looking to grow its sales team around the world to drive ad sales to agencies and brands. As BeReal's Client Partner, you will be responsible for designing and executing the local South Korean sales strategy by selling traditional and innovative ad inventory to key agencies & clients.

You will leverage Voodoo's unique know-how in app monetization to establish new business for BeReal.

You will need extensive brand and agency contacts in South Korea at major Holdcos (Cheil Worldwide, Innocean Worldwide, HS Ad, Daehong Communications, etc) and independent local media agencies to succeed. These contacts should be decision makers for trading, social media and investment teams.

You need to have a deep knowledge of the digital advertising landscape and particularly the South Korean media agency ecosystem.

You will be also responsible for the long-term development of business relationships with these prospects.

  • Own your local agency strategy and roadmap.

  • Build awareness and adoption around BeReal offering with agencies through client presentations, conference attendance and networking events.

  • Combine new business development and sales skills with long-term relationship management.

  • Engage with senior agency executives to drive deal growth in the long-term.

  • Communicate effectively internally to coordinate resources (Ads Ops, Publishing Management, User acquisition, etc...) and effectively sell our inventory

Profile

  • You have 5 years+ of experience in digital ad sales in South Korea with an outstanding track record in selling ad products to Agencies.

  • Social media mobile experience is a strong plus.

  • You have a strong track record working with local media agencies and understanding the South Korean advertising ecosystem.

  • A high degree of creativity, self-motivation, and drive.

  • An expert in managing a portfolio of clients and understanding the mobile ecosystem in a way that you can respond thoroughly and persuasively to the client's needs and questions.

  • Fluency in Korean and English is required.

 - Cultural Product Adaptation: Work closely with product and design teams to adapt BeReal's features to Japanese user preferences, privacy expectations, and social behaviors

 - User Acquisition & Growth: Lead comprehensive user acquisition campaigns across digital channels, campus initiatives, influencer partnerships, and local events

 - Strategic Partnerships: Build and manage partnerships with universities, local brands, media companies, and content creators to accelerate growth

 - Platform-Specific Growth: Develop growth loops leveraging Japan's unique social media landscape (LINE, Twitter/X, TikTok, etc.)

 - Product Feedback Loop: Serve as the voice of Japanese users to headquarters, identifying successful features and areas for improvement

 - Budget & Operations Management: Oversee marketing and operational budgets while ensuring efficient resource allocation

 - Performance Accountability: Track and optimize key metrics (DAU, retention, virality) while reporting insights and results to headquarters


PROFILE

 - 7+ years of experience in market development, growth, or general management roles, preferably in consumer tech or social media

 - Proven track record of successfully launching and scaling digital products in the Japanese market

 - Deep understanding of Japanese culture, social media landscape, and consumer behavior patterns

 - Experience building and leading cross-functional teams in fast-paced, high-growth environments

 - Strong analytical mindset with experience in growth metrics, user acquisition, and performance marketing

 - Excellent communication skills in both Japanese and English, with ability to present to C-level executives

 - Experience working with international headquarters while managing local market needs

 - Entrepreneurial mindset with ability to operate independently and make strategic decisions

 - Network within Japan's tech, media, or influencer ecosystem is highly valued

 - Bachelor's degree required; MBA or equivalent advanced degree preferred

jobs.title: Lead UI/UX Designer - Mob Control
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

This position is fully remote within CET time ±2h.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.

You will be joining one of our live studios, working on Mob Control.

Mob Control is a mobile game with over 400 million downloads and millions of daily players. This is a rare opportunity to contribute to an evolving live game, while having meaningful ownership over the player experience. You’ll work within a fast-moving, cross-functional team focused on long-term product growth, player engagement, and LiveOps-driven evolution.

Role

As Lead UI/UX Designer, you'll play a key role in shaping the player experience, combining UX strategy with visual execution to deliver clean, scalable, and intuitive systems.

  • Own the UX strategy and UI execution across gameplay, metagame, and LiveOps content

  • Design player journeys for onboarding, FTUE, events, upgrades, store, and retention systems

  • Create user flows, wireframes, and interactive prototypes using Figma (or similar)

  • Translate UX into polished, high-fidelity UI mockups with clear hierarchy and visual consistency

  • Build and evolve component-based UI systems and a shared style guide

  • Collaborate across disciplines—from product and game design to art and engineering

  • Contribute UX thinking to early-stage feature ideation

  • Use player data, feedback, and playtests to iterate and improve flows and experiences

Profile

  • 6+ years in UI/UX or Product Design, preferably in mobile games or fast-scaling products

  • A portfolio that demonstrates systems thinking and polished UI design

  • Deep proficiency with Figma and working knowledge of Unity

  • Solid grasp of behavioral UX, cognitive load, and attention-driven interaction design

  • Experience working in LiveOps or GaaS-driven environments

  • Strong communication skills, you can confidently present and defend design decisions

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits according to the country you reside

jobs.title: Product Manager - Cortex Studio
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular Studios like BeachBum and apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

This position can be Paris-based or fully remote within a +/- 2hr time difference with Paris.

Team

Join a small, agile team working on The Almanac, a daily puzzle app built to sharpen your mind and cut through brain rot. Each session is designed to be simple, beautiful, and mentally stimulating, a moment of clarity in a noisy world.

Our goal is to build a product that respects the user’s intelligence and makes them feel good about themselves. We do not design for addiction or noise but for focus, flow, and elegance.

Role

You will design features and systems that increase engagement and monetization. You will follow production closely to ensure every detail is executed at the highest quality. You will act as the bridge between the design and development teams, turning ideas into polished, well-crafted player experiences.

  • You will write clear, actionable specs for new features and systems, from progression to events and monetization flows.

  • Work hand in hand with developers to ensure smooth delivery and consistency.

  • Use analytics and player feedback to identify opportunities for better retention and monetization.

  • Maintain a coherent visual language that enhances focus and motivation.

  • Stay informed on best practices across puzzle, learning, and productivity apps.

Profile

  • Founder mentality, proactive, hands-on, and ownership-driven

  • Obsessed with quality and strong attention to detail

  • Structured thinker who connects design, data, and product logic

  • Thinks in systems, not screens

  • Excellence in writing specs, prototype features, and own a roadmap from idea to release.

  • Capable of light coding or building prototypes to test ideas quickly.

Benefits: competitive salary + performance bonus and other benefits according to the country you reside.

jobs.title: Head of Performance Marketing - Apps
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Growth team helps maximize the potential of each Voodoo product within the ecosystem. Our Growth team is split into several job expertise such as user acquisition, ad monetization, video ads, playable ads, and influencer marketers. Being part of the Growth Team at Voodoo requires a lot of operational excellence and creativity in order to constantly adapt ourselves to stay ahead of the rest of the market.

Role

As the Head of Performance Marketing - Consumer Apps, you will be responsible for scaling our portfolio of social apps worldwide, with a specific focus on BeReal and Wizz.

You will lead and build a team of 10+ people to cover paid growth, while reporting to the VP Growth and working closely with our CEO.

The ideal candidate is a data-driven growth leader with a structured mindset, a passion for growth hacking, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment.

  • Build the growth strategy to scale our top mobile apps such as Wizz or BeReal

  • Execute our growth acquisition channels, including paid UA, partnerships, featuring deals, app store relationships, cross-promotion, PR, influencer marketing, growth hacking, ASO and community building.

  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and competitors’ growth strategies to identify the last performing channels we can activate.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth execution of the growth strategy, building strong partnerships and leverage resources effectively.

  • Conduct systematic data analysis and leverage key metrics to measure channels performances, drive decision-making, prioritize growth initiatives and identify improvement opportunities.

Profile

  • You have at least 4-8 years of experience in scaling apps, mobile preferably

  • You have already managed a team of at least 5 people

  • You show strong interest and knowledge of the mobile apps industry

  • You understand the mobile growth ecosystem in detail (Privacy, MMP, etc.) as well as branding performance 

  • You are a data-driven, growth hacker with a structured mindset

  • You have entrepreneurial mindset and can adapt to a high-paced environment

  • You can demonstrate excellent teamwork and collaboration skills

  • You are fluent in English (fluency in French is a plus)

Benefits

  • Competitive salary upon experience

  • Swile restaurant lunch voucher

  • Gymlib sports subscription (100% taken in charge by us)

  • Sidecare healthcare coverage for your family

  • Child day care facilities (Les Petits Chaperons rouge)

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

  • Creative hackathon

  • Unlimited vacation policy

  • Full stack desk and computer equipment upon your request

  • Cooperate within a globally diverse team and a rich cross-cultural work environment

    • Coach under-performers and make tough calls when necessary.

    • Create a performance-driven, collaborative team culture.

  • Lead performance marketing strategy across multiple game launches

    • Define tunnel-wide growth strategies for your entire gaming portfolio.

    • Partner with studios to align on targets, timings, and tactics.

    • Own flawless execution—your team delivers, no matter what.

  • Personally manage our top-performing games

    • Take direct ownership of UA for some of our highest-priority titles.

    • Set the standard for strategy, execution, and performance within the team.

    • Lead by example through hands-on campaign management and optimization.

  • Boost performance, every day

    • Dive into campaign data to identify opportunities and signals.

    • Increase ROAS across channels through creative iteration and data insights.

    • Set up clear forecasting, pacing, and growth reporting.

  • Collaborate to unlock growth multipliers

    • Partner closely with studios, product managers, creative strategists, data scientists and more.

    • Shape product decisions through a growth lens.

    • Test bold ideas and deploy innovative UA tactics across the portfolio.

  • Shape the tools that power our growth

    • Use our in-house UA automation systems.

    • Provide structured feedback to stakeholders in order to continuously improve performance.

  • Be a thought leader

    • Share UA insights and growth innovations across the org.

    • Mentor peers and contribute to a learning culture.

    • Drive cross-functional initiatives that raise the bar for growth excellence.

Profile

  • Battle-tested in mobile applications performance marketing: 5+ years in performance marketing / UA, with real impact on high-scale mobile games.

  • Proven leadership experience: You've led and grown high-performing teams and know how to spot (and coach) top talent.

  • Paid acquisition expert:

    • Mastery of major UA platforms: Meta, TikTok, Applovin, AdMob, DSPs…

    • You think in test plans and incremental wins.

    • You structure learning loops that scale.

  • Entrepreneurial and adaptable:

    • Thrive in a fast-paced, ambitious environment.

    • You get things done and keep pushing the frontier.

  • Excellent communicator and collaborator:

    • You drive alignment across disciplines and keep people inspired.

  • Fluent in English (French is a plus, but not a must.)

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% covered by Voodoo)

  • Premium healthcare coverage with SideCare, 100% covered for you and your family

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

  • Remote days on Fridays

jobs.title: Experienced Solutions Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

The Engineering & Data team builds innovative tech products and platforms to support the impressive growth of their gaming and consumer apps which allow Voodoo to stay at the forefront of the mobile gaming industry.

As part of a fast-paced AdTech environment, you’ll gain deep exposure to the mechanics of mobile advertising: how campaigns are configured, delivered, and optimized across an ad network. You’ll also contribute to SDK integrations and provide direct support to publishers, ensuring seamless adoption of our technology and maximizing performance across their apps. This role will give you high visibility, as your contributions directly impact revenue growth and partner satisfaction.

Role

We are seeking a Solutions Engineer to join Voodoo’s Ad Network Engineering team. This is the first role of its kind within the team, giving you the opportunity to shape how we support and scale our Ad Network. You will be part of a dynamic Product & Engineering organization and report directly to an Engineering Manager.

In this role, your mission will be to ensure the successful adoption and smooth operation of Voodoo’s Ad Network products, from intuitive UIs and powerful APIs for advertisers and publishers to SDKs integrated directly into our games.

You’ll quickly become a power user of our platform, with a unique opportunity to bridge the gap between technology and business impact. To achieve this, you will:

  • Support internal teams and external partners in integrating and using our products.

  • Troubleshoot issues across the stack (SDKs, APIs, and UIs), ensuring reliability and fast resolution.

  • Provide clear and practical documentation that helps users succeed independently.

  • Collaborate closely with product managers and engineers to escalate issues, shape new features, and give feedback based on real-world usage.

  • Spot patterns in recurring problems and turn them into actionable insights that improve both the product and the organization’s efficiency.

If you enjoy solving complex problems, working at the intersection of users and engineering, and want to grow your expertise in AdTech while making a tangible impact, this role is for you.

Profile

  • You have 3–5+ years of experience in a Solutions Engineer, Technical Account Manager, or similar role, ideally in AdTech, SaaS, or a developer-facing environment.

  • You are comfortable working across UI, APIs, and SDKs, and can troubleshoot issues spanning front-end, backend, and integrations.

  • You combine good technical skills (reading logs, querying APIs, debugging SDKs) with excellent communication skills to explain solutions clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • You thrive in fast-paced environments, focusing on impact and business outcomes rather than rigid processes.

  • You are customer-oriented, with a genuine desire to help internal teams, publishers, and advertisers succeed with the product.

  • You enjoy being the bridge between engineering and users, able to translate real-world problems into actionable insights for product and engineering teams.

  • You are proactive, resourceful, and curious, eager to learn the inner workings of the AdTech ecosystem and continuously grow your expertise.

  • You are a true team player, thriving in an international and diverse environment, and open to giving and receiving feedback to continuously improve.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary based on experience

  • Swile Lunch voucher

  • Gymlib (100% covered by Voodoo)

  • Premium healthcare coverage with SideCare, 100% covered for you and your family

  • Wellness activities in our Paris office

  • Remote Fridays

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.

You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on Paper.io 2.

With Paper.io 2, we’re building an iconic game that players will never forget!

We're a small team of excellent people who take care of everything from ideas to testing, and we intend to grow while maintaining our high standards.

Role

  • Support the Art director in the ideation and execution of the game’s vision.

  • Design and implement a high-quality, scalable UI.

  • Develop and optimize UX flows of new and existing features.

  • Create and maintain a comprehensive UI Style Bible and reusable component libraries.

  • Create high-quality 2D assets (menus, HUDs, buttons, icons, etc) and ensure optimal performance across mobile devices.

  • Work with Game Designers and the Product Team to ensure UI supports gameplay and accessibility goals.

  • Iterate quickly based on team feedback and live user data.

  • Propose creative ideas to boost player engagement and improve the user experience.

Profile

  • 4+ years experience as a UI/UX Artist on shipped mobile games.

  • You must have experience designing in Figma.

  • Excellent design skills, with a keen eye for visual hierarchy, composition, and readability.

  • Experience with A/B testing interfaces or working with LiveOps features.

  • A keen eye for emerging mobile game trends with the ability to creatively deconstruct and learn from success cases.

  • Ability to design, document and execute a consistent UI visual language.

  • Experience collaborating with cross-functional remote teams.

  • Fluent in English.

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits according to the country you reside

jobs.descriptionHtml:

Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.

Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.

You'll join one of our key title, Mob Control.

Role

As the Product Director for Mob Control, you will be a key owner of the product's vision, execution and strategic direction. Your mission is to help evolve the game, with the ultimate goal of turning Mob Control into a top-performing title in the midcore game market.

  • Shape and Execute the Product Vision: As part of the studio leadership, you will co-define and execute our vision-driven product roadmap. You will be responsible for translating this shared vision into actionable initiatives that drive growth and delight players.

  • Lead Major Product Initiatives: You will own and guide critical new work tracks from concept to launch, focusing on high-impact projects that enhance core gameplay, introduce innovative features, and improve the overall game feel and polish.

  • Drive Monetization Strategy: You will be responsible for the game's economy and monetization strategy (both IAP and Ads). Your goal is to create a balanced system that offers great value to players while driving revenue growth.

  • Champion a Data-Informed Culture: Lead the analysts team to make informed decisions. You'll foster a culture of learning, helping the team understand why features succeed or fail to guide future development.

  • Be the Market Expert: Keep a close pulse on the puzzle game market and key competitors to identify new opportunities, trends, and best practices that can be applied to make Block Jam a leader in the genre.

Key Objectives

  • Innovate and Differentiate: Lead the charge in developing unique features and experiences that make Block Jam stand out in a competitive market.

  • Drive Sustainable Growth: Identify and execute on strategies that deliver measurable improvements in key metrics, including player retention, engagement, and monetization.

  • Deliver a World-Class Player Experience: Continuously seek opportunities to improve the core gameplay loop and meta, ensuring the game is fun, engaging, and visually appealing.

Profile

  • Proven experience in mobile gaming, with successful titles.

  • Background as Product Director, Product Owner (in a large company), or senior Product Manager/Game Designer at director level.

  • Strong expertise in product management: strategy, roadmapping, and prioritization.

  • Solid knowledge of economy and systems design, particularly for puzzle games.

  • Strong ability to interpret data and lead product decisions based on analytics.

  • Self-motivated, with excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

  • Clear and effective communicator, able to align diverse stakeholders.

  • Passion for puzzle games and deep understanding of market trends and player expectations.

Benefits

  • Best-in-class compensation

  • Other benefits according to the country you reside
